title: UK police crack down on phrase ‘globalise the Intifada’
description: Sky News host Danica De Giorgio analyses police in the UK cracking down the chant “globalise the Intifada”.  “Police over there are now cracking down,” Ms De Giorgio said.  “Why has it taken an alleged terror attack for that hideous phrase to be cracked down upon?”

title: ‘For two years he was warned’: Albanese could not defend the Jewish community
description: Former Victorian Liberal Party president Michael Kroger says Prime Minister Anthony Albanese was warned for two years prior to the Bondi massacre about defending the Jewish community from antisemitism.  “This is a bloke that couldn’t even keep his own electorate office open because he was so fearful of offending pro-Palestinian demonstrators,” Mr Kroger said.  “Why would anyone think he could defend the Jewish community?”

title: ‘Government of social justice’: Albanese is not ‘fair dinkum’ about protecting Jews
description: Former prime minister Tony Abbott says the Albanese government has never been “fair dinkum” about protecting Jewish people.   “This government has never been fair dinkum about protecting Jewish people, frankly, I don’t think it’s been fair dinkum about standing up for Australian values,” Mr Abbott told Sky News Senior Reporter Caroline Marcus.  “We’ve got a government of social justice activists, we don’t have a government which is serious about keeping Australians safe.”

title: Albanese ‘will cooperate’ with NSW government royal commission into Bondi massacre
description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says the federal government “will cooperate” with the NSW government on the royal commission into the Bondi massacre.

title: Bombshell phone call shows Rabbi blaming Anthony Albanese for Bondi massacre
description: Sky News Senior Reporter Caroline Marcus reveals details about the head Rabbi of the synagogue whose Hanukkah event was targeted in last Sunday's terror attack.  Ms Marcus said the Rabbi told Prime Minister Anthony Albanese he was “not welcome” at his synagogue.  “Now, I can show you a recording of the explosive phone call between Rabbi Ulman and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu after the massacre, where the respected Jewish leader blames Anthony Albanese and his foreign affairs minister Penny Wong for the bloodshed.”

title: Calls mount for a royal commission into Bondi massacre
description: Writer and broadcaster Kel Richards discusses the calls growing louder for Prime Minister Anthony Albanese to call a Bondi massacre royal commission.  “Perhaps inspired by what happened last night,” Mr Richards said.  “Anthony Albanese today did say sorry.”

title: ‘We will keep mobilising’: Palestine Action Group responds to Minns’ protest laws
description: Palestine Action Group Spokesperson Josh Lees has responded to new protest laws introduced by New South Wales Premier Chris Minns.   “We are going to keep mobilising because, tragically, the genocide in Gaza does continue,” Mr Lees said.   “We completely oppose Chris Minns’ latest bout of knee-jerk anti-protest laws, which are seeking to exploit this tragedy to take away the Democratic rights of everyone in New South Wales.”

title: ‘Not great’: Bill Clinton’s public image trashed after new photo’s released from Epstein files
description: Sky News contributor Kosha Gada says Bill Clinton’s new images in the Epstein files are “not great” for his public image.  Ms Gada told Sky News Senior Reporter Caroline Marcus that it is still not “as damaging” as it would’ve been if it were released in his heyday.  “But it’s obviously not great.”

title: ‘Intense backlash’: DOJ release ‘heavily censored’ Epstein files
description: Sky News Senior Reporter Caroline Marcus says US President Donald Trump’s justice department is copping “intense backlash” for the Epstein documents.  Ms Marcus said the files released were “heavily censored”.  “Victims of Jeffrey Epstein's sex crimes have accused the Trump administration of protecting the elite men involved in the scandal.”

title: Pro-Palestine rally at Sydney church is ‘despicable’
description: Executive Council of Australian Jewry co-CEO Alex Ryvchin joins Sky News Senior Reporter Caroline Marcus to go over the recent Bondi shooting and a pro-Palestine rally at Sydney.  “These people are despicable, they are the worst of the worst,” Mr Ryvchin said.  “They use all of these things as a gimmick, as a device to attack Jewish people.”

title: Anthony Albanese will not call a royal commission into the Bondi Beach massacre
description: Jewish community member Marnie Perlstein says a royal commission into the Bondi Beach terror attack is the least the Albanese government can do.  “I feel that the deadly terrorist attack on Australian soil warrants the very highest level of independent inquiry,” Ms Perlstein told Sky News host Danica De Giorgio.  “It is the least that the Albanese government can do.”

title: New laws mandate big supermarkets to accept cash
description: Writer and broadcaster Kel Richards analyses new laws coming in to mandate Australian supermarkets and service stations to accept cash.  “We have, for a long time been totally dependent on our plastic money, on our cards,” Mr Richards said.  “Laws have been passed, which means major retailers, major businesses, the big ones, will have to accept cash.”

title: ‘Beyond politics’: Albanese’s apology to Jews comes across as ‘incredibly’ insincere
description: Sky News host Danica De Giorgio analyses Prime Minister Anthony Albanese apologising to the Jewish community for the Bondi massacre.  “Under pressure and missing in action, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese today said sorry to the Jewish community,” Ms De Giorgio said.  “So now he says he is sorry, better late than never but call me cynical, I don’t believe him.”

title: ‘International pariah’: Albanese resists calls for royal commission into Bondi massacre
description: Former Victoria Liberal Party president Michael Kroger says Prime Minister Anthony Albanese is an “international pariah” after not wanting to call a royal commission into the Bondi Beach massacre.  “He [Anthony Albanese] was warned for two years this bloke, for two years he was warned by the Jewish community,” Mr Kroger told Sky News host Danica De Giorgio.  “He won’t call a royal commission, for goodness sake … this guy is just an international pariah.”

title: ‘Disgraceful act’: People ‘hijack’ Bondi vigil to express pre-existing hatred of Albanese
description: Sky News contributor Joe Hildebrand says it was a “disgraceful act” for people to boo Prime Minister Anthony Albanese at the memorial service in Bondi.  Mr Hildebrand said it was “incredibly disrespectful” to the victims.  “I think there are a lot of people who are just using this and trying to hijack this tragedy as a vehicle for their own pre-existing hatred of Albanese.”
